prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a long, thin, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.5312, 0.6281, 0.0] Create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. Within the sketch, draw a rectangle with the following vertices: * Line 1: [0, 0] to [0.0687, 0] * Line 2: [0.0687, 0] to [0.0687, 0.75] * Line 3: [0.0687, 0.75] to [0, 0.75] * Line 4: [0, 0.75] to [0, 0] After creating the rectangle, scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with the following parameters: * Extrude depth towards normal: 0.0047 * Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0047 * Sketch scale: 0.75 The resulting part should be a long, thin, rectangular prism with the following dimensions: * Length: 0.75 * Width: 0.0094 * Height: 0.75 Part 2: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.6, 0.6, 0.0] Create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. Within the sketch, draw a rectangle with the following vertices: * Line 1: [0, 0] to [0.0187, 0] * Line 2: [0.0187, 0] to [0.0187, 0.0687] * Line 3: [0.0187, 0.0687] to [0, 0.0687] * Line 4: [0, 0.0687] to [0, 0] Next, draw a line from the point [0, 0] to [0.0687, 0.0687]. This will create a sloped side at a 45-degree angle. After creating the shape, scale the sketch by a factor of 0.0687. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with the following parameters: * Extrude depth towards normal: 0 * Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.6 * Sketch scale: 0.0687 The resulting part should be a rectangular prism with a sloped side and the following dimensions: * Length: 0.6 * Width: 0.0687 * Height: 0.0687</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism with Tapered Middle Section Step 1: Create a 2D Sketch Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin (0, 0) with no rotation and no translation vector. Create a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of this coordinate system. Step 2: Draw the Sketch Draw a rectangle by creating four lines (line\\_1, line\\_2, line\\_3, line\\_4) as follows: * line\\_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] * line\\_2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.25] * line\\_3: Start Point [0.75, 0.25], End Point [0.0, 0.25] * line\\_4: Start Point [0.0, 0.25], End Point [0.0, 0.0] This rectangle forms the top face of the prism. At this point, the sketch should resemble the top of the prism with a flat top and bottom, and sides that are perpendicular to the top and bottom faces. Step 3: Scale the Sketch Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75 (sketch\\_scale) to create a slightly narrower shape for the middle section of the prism. This will narrow the prism by a factor of 0.75. Step 4: Transform the Scaled 2D Sketch into a 3D Sketch Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Step 5: Extrude the 2D Sketch to Generate the 3D Model Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis by a depth of 0.4167 (extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal) away from the sketch plane to create the 3D model. This will create the final shape of the prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section, where the top and bottom faces are parallel to each other and the middle section is slightly narrower than the top and bottom. Final Shape: Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom, and a Slightly Tapered Middle Section The final shape has a length of 0.75, a width of 0.75, and a height of 0.4167. It has one part: the previously described rectangular prism.</description>
